p: The E. ciliata ethanolic extract and essential oil microcapsules using GUM, SKIM, BCYC, MD, SCA, and RMD as encapsulating agents were obtained by spray-drying. The microcapsulesâ€™ morphologies were observed by using scanning electron microscopy (SEM) ( Figure 11). Analyzing the micrographs, the most common morphology of microcapsules was semi-spherical. There are two types of microparticle morphologies: particles with smooth surface and particles with a concave and folded surface.
